â
| align="center"| [[Image:KatyKurtzman-LindsayBlaisdel.jpg|100px]]
+
| style="background:white" colspan="4" | Lindsay is the teenage daughter of [[Matthew Blaisdel|Matthew]] and [[Claudia Blaisdel Carrington|Claudia Blaisdel]]. With fragile Claudia newly-released from a sanitarium after a breakdown, mother and daughter are trying to reconnect. Hurt and traumatized by the ordeal, Lindsay is further swept up in her parents' domestic troubles. Matthew leaves the country with Lindsay after discovering Claudia's affair with [[Steven Carrington]]; Claudia subsequently does everything within her power — including things she finds despicable — to find Lindsay. Matthew and Lindsay are later presumed dead in a car crash in the [[Peru]]vian jungle.
â
| style="background:white" colspan="3" | Lindsay is the teenage daughter of [[Matthew Blaisdel|Matthew]] and [[Claudia Blaisdel Carrington|Claudia Blaisdel]]. With fragile Claudia newly-released from a sanitarium after a breakdown, mother and daughter are trying to reconnect. Hurt and traumatized by the ordeal, Lindsay is further swept up in her parents' domestic troubles. Matthew leaves the country with Lindsay after discovering Claudia's affair with [[Steven Carrington]]; Claudia subsequently does everything within her power — including things she finds despicable — to find Lindsay. Matthew and Lindsay are later presumed dead in a car crash in the [[Peru]]vian jungle.
 
Matthew mentions to [[Krystle Carrington]] during his 1987 return that Lindsay had died from the injuries she sustained in the car crash.
Matthew mentions to [[Krystle Carrington]] during his 1987 return that Lindsay had died from the injuries she sustained in the car crash.

â
| align="center"| [[Image:TerriGarber-LeslieCarrington.jpg|100px]]
+
| style="background:white" colspan="4" | [[Ben Carrington]]'s daughter Leslie comes to town to confront the father who abandoned her. There she runs into former flame [[Dex Dexter]], and dallies with [[Michael Culhane]]. After falling into an affair with a married [[Jeff Colby]], Leslie becomes [[Alexis Colby]]'s protÃ©gÃ©, but is fired for also having an affair with Alexis' husband, [[Sean Rowan]]. Leslie is later involved with [[Clay Fallmont]], but when it is revealed he may also be Ben's son, he breaks it off and leaves town. Sean takes Leslie hostage and beats her when his schemes unravel, but Leslie manages to contact her cousin, [[Steven Carrington]]; this is the last that is seen of Leslie.
â
| style="background:white" colspan="3" | [[Ben Carrington]]'s daughter Leslie comes to town to confront the father who abandoned her. There she runs into former flame [[Dex Dexter]], and dallies with [[Michael Culhane]]. After falling into an affair with a married [[Jeff Colby]], Leslie becomes [[Alexis Colby]]'s protÃ©gÃ©, but is fired for also having an affair with Alexis' husband, [[Sean Rowan]]. Leslie is later involved with [[Clay Fallmont]], but when it is revealed he may also be Ben's son, he breaks it off and leaves town. Sean takes Leslie hostage and beats her when his schemes unravel, but Leslie manages to contact her cousin, [[Steven Carrington]]; this is the last that is seen of Leslie.

Line 139: Line 139:
| align="center"|
| align="center"|
|-
|-
â
| align="center"| [[Image:LloydBochner-CecilColby.jpg|100px]]
+
| style="background:white" colspan="4" | The uncle of [[Jeff Colby]], Cecil is a longtime friend and business rival of [[Blake Carrington]]. He makes a deal with Blake's daughter [[Fallon Carrington Colby|Fallon]]: she marries Jeff, and in exchange Cecil will lend Blake financial assistance. CEO of the oil company ColbyCo, Cecil later tries to destroy Blake using the persona Logan Rhinewood. Soon after her arrival, Blake's ex-wife [[Alexis Colby|Alexis Carrington]] tells [[Steven Carrington|Steven]] that Cecil is Fallon's father; Fallon eventually finds out, but it is untimately proven untrue. Cecil becomes romantically involved with Alexis, but has a heart attack while in bed with her. He marries her on his deathbed, hoping she will use ColbyCo to ruin Blake.
â
| style="background:white" colspan="3" | The uncle of [[Jeff Colby]], Cecil is a longtime friend and business rival of [[Blake Carrington]]. He makes a deal with Blake's daughter [[Fallon Carrington Colby|Fallon]]: she marries Jeff, and in exchange Cecil will lend Blake financial assistance. CEO of the oil company ColbyCo, Cecil later tries to destroy Blake using the persona Logan Rhinewood. Soon after her arrival, Blake's ex-wife [[Alexis Colby|Alexis Carrington]] tells [[Steven Carrington|Steven]] that Cecil is Fallon's father; Fallon eventually finds out, but it is untimately proven untrue. Cecil becomes romantically involved with Alexis, but has a heart attack while in bed with her. He marries her on his deathbed, hoping she will use ColbyCo to ruin Blake.

| align="center"| [[Image:StephanieBeacham-SableColby.jpg|100px]]
+
| style="background:white" colspan="4" | The wife of Colby Enterprises magnate [[Jason Colby]] and first cousin of [[Alexis Colby|Alexis]], Sable first visits Denver in "[[The Titans (Dynasty)|The Titans]]" (1985). She later returns in "[[A Touch of Sable (Dynasty)|A Touch of Sable]]" (1988), supporting friend [[Blake Carrington|Blake]] as he struggles with [[Krystle Carrington|Krystle]]'s illness and the troubles caused by the Collection. Sable is soon at odds with Alexis, and becomes romantically involved with Alexis' ex-husband, [[Dex Dexter]].
â
| style="background:white" colspan="3" | The wife of Colby Enterprises magnate [[Jason Colby]] and first cousin of [[Alexis Colby|Alexis]], Sable first visits Denver in "[[The Titans (Dynasty)|The Titans]]" (1985). She later returns in "[[A Touch of Sable (Dynasty)|A Touch of Sable]]" (1988), supporting friend [[Blake Carrington|Blake]] as he struggles with [[Krystle Carrington|Krystle]]'s illness and the troubles caused by the Collection. Sable is soon at odds with Alexis, and becomes romantically involved with Alexis' ex-husband, [[Dex Dexter]].

+
| style="background:white" colspan="4" | Longtime [[Carrington family|Carrington]] cook Hilda Nielsen Gunnerson (usually referred to as "Mrs. Gunnerson") is close to the family, and according to a Season Two episode was hired by [[Alexis Colby]] while she was still married to [[Blake Carrington|Blake]]. Mrs. Gunnerson is among the household staff abducted by [[Matthew Blaisdel]] along with the Carringtons in Season Eight.
â
| style="background:white" colspan="3" | Longtime [[Carrington family|Carrington]] cook Hilda Nielsen Gunnerson (usually referred to as "Mrs. Gunnerson") is close to the family, and according to a Season Two episode was hired by [[Alexis Colby]] while she was still married to [[Blake Carrington|Blake]]. Mrs. Gunnerson is among the household staff abducted by [[Matthew Blaisdel]] along with the Carringtons in Season Eight.

Walter's death is eventually noted in the Season Six episode "[[The Proposal (Dynasty)|The Proposal]]" (1985).

Line 343: Line 343:
| align="center"|
| align="center"|
|-
|-
â
| align="center"| [[Image:JamesFarentino-NickToscanni.jpg|100px]]
+
| style="background:white" colspan="4" | [[Blake Carrington]] asks his friend and employee Nick, a psychologist, to look in on fragile [[Claudia Blaisdel Carrington|Claudia Blaisdel]] after her release from the hospital. Nick saves a suicidal Claudia's life and helps her recover from the disappearance of her husband and daughter, but Nick also holds a secret grudge against Blake and vows revenge. The charismatic doctor flirts with Blake's wife [[Krystle Carrington|Krystle]] and beds Blake's married daughter [[Fallon Carrington Colby|Fallon]] as he looks for a way to destroy the Carrington patriarch. Finally, Nick confronts Blake about his part in the death of Nick's brother; Blake denies any wrongdoing, but is thrown from his horse and knocked unconscious. Nick leaves him unaided, and leaves [[Denver, Colorado|Denver]].
â
| style="background:white" colspan="3" | [[Blake Carrington]] asks his friend and employee Nick, a psychologist, to look in on fragile [[Claudia Blaisdel Carrington|Claudia Blaisdel]] after her release from the hospital. Nick saves a suicidal Claudia's life and helps her recover from the disappearance of her husband and daughter, but Nick also holds a secret grudge against Blake and vows revenge. The charismatic doctor flirts with Blake's wife [[Krystle Carrington|Krystle]] and beds Blake's married daughter [[Fallon Carrington Colby|Fallon]] as he looks for a way to destroy the Carrington patriarch. Finally, Nick confronts Blake about his part in the death of Nick's brother; Blake denies any wrongdoing, but is thrown from his horse and knocked unconscious. Nick leaves him unaided, and leaves [[Denver, Colorado|Denver]].
